quote_first: He left the Sherry-Netherland just after
quote_last: , and by the time he reached Lexington, he was just about ready to face the headmaster’s wrath.
quote_raw: He left the Sherry-Netherland just after 8:40, and by the time he reached Lexington, he was just about ready to face the headmaster’s wrath.
title: Cometh the Hour
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_last: she was wheeled out on a stretcher headed for Mayo General Hospital, blistered and burned by a tanning bed turned torture chamber.
quote_raw: At 8:40 A.M. she was wheeled out on a stretcher headed for Mayo General Hospital, blistered and burned by a tanning bed turned torture chamber.
title: Pomegranate Soup
author: Marsha Mehran

quote_first: At this moment the clock indicated
quote_last: . "Five minutes more," said Andrew Stuart. The five friends looked at each other. One may surmise that their heart-beats were slightly accelerated, for, even for bold gamblers, the stake was a large one.
quote_raw: At this moment the clock indicated 8.40. "Five minutes more," said Andrew Stuart. The five friends looked at each other. One may surmise that their heart-beats were slightly accelerated, for, even for bold gamblers, the stake was a large one.
title: Around the World in Eighty Days
author: Jules Verne

quote_first: It was when I stood before her, avoiding her eyes, that I took note of the surrounding objects in detail, and saw that her watch had stopped at
quote_last: , and that a clock in the room had stopped at twenty minutes to nine.
quote_raw: It was when I stood before her, avoiding her eyes, that I took note of the surrounding objects in detail, and saw that her watch had stopped at twenty minutes to nine, and that a clock in the room had stopped at twenty minutes to nine.
title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
